Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Researcher at BRUEGEL, Bruxelles, Belgium. Research Projects: Higher education, Migration and mobility, Avenues for reforming the EU budget.
Visiting Professor: Department of Economics, University of Sassari, Italy
Senior Researcher, Department of International Comparisons and European Integration, Institute for Employment Research - IAB Nurnberg, Germany
Master Lecture/Seminar Microeconomics Theory of Education, University of Bamberg, Germany
PhD Lecture/Seminar Migration and Labour Supply, University of Konstanz, Germany

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relatore: Aix-Marseille Spring School in Economics “Recent Advance in Labour Economics”, Organizer: GREQAM, Aix-en-Provence, France
Relatore: Regional Studies Association Annual International Conference, “Regions: The Dilemmas of Integration and Competition”, University of Economics, Prague, Czech Republic
Relatore: ESPE Annual Conference of the European Society for Population Economics, University College London, London, United Kingdom
Relatore: International Conference on Educational Economics, University of Athens, Athens, Greece
Relatore: The Journées Louis-André Gérard-Varet, University of the Mediterranean, Marseille, France
Relatore: PET Annual conference of the Association of Public Economic Theory, Boğaziçi University, Istanbul, Turkey
Organizzatore: Frontiers of Migration Research, IAB/HWWI Transnationality of Migrants (TOM), IAB, Bamberg, Germany
Relatore: EEA Congress of the European Economic Association, Glasgow, Scotland
Relatore: SIEP Annual Conference of the Italian Association of Public Economic, Pavia, Italy
Relatore: RSA-SIE, Annual Conference of the Italian Economic Association, Catania, Italy;
Relatore: Summer Workshop in Economics, invited presentation, Università G.d’Annunzio, Pescara, Italy;
Relatore: ESPE Annual Conference of the European Society for Population Economics, University of Bern, Bern, Switzerland;
Relatore: EEA-ESEM, Congress of the European Economic Association and the Econometric Society European meeting, Malaga, Spain;
Relatore: NORFACE Migration Conference: "Migration: Global Development, New Frontiers", University College London, London, United Kingdom;
Organizzatore: Workshop on the New IAB-SOEP Migration Sample, Nürnberg, Germany
Relatore: ESPE Annual Conference of the European Society for Population Economics, Braga, Portugal;
Relatore: AEL Association for Social Policy, University of Passau, Passau, Germany;
Relatore: EALE European Association of Labour Economists University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia

Relatore: PET Annual conference of the Association of Public Economic Theory, Luxembourg, Luxembourg;
Relatore: EEA Annual Conference of the European Economic Association, Mannheim, Germany;
Relatore: AIEL Annual Conference of the Italian Association of Labour Economics, Cagliari, Italy;
Relatore: ASSET Annual Meeting of the Association of Southern European Economic Theorists, Granada, Spain;
Relatore: LEER, Leuven Economics of Education Research Workshop ‘Efficiency in Education and the use of Big data’, Leuven, Belgium;
Relatore: IISES 23rd International Academic Conference in Economics, Venice, Italy;
Relatore: XIX Applied Economic Meeting, Seville, Spain;
Relatore: IMAEF Applied Economics and Finance Meeting, Corfu, Greece;

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Componente estreno: PRIN 2004, “Asymmetric information, systemic risk and fragility in financial markets and networks”
Componente esterno: PRIN 2006, “The relevance of financial market imperfections for stability, growth and economic policies”
Componente: TEporary Migration, integration and the role of POlicies - TEMPO, NORFACE Research Programme
Componente: Transnationality of Migrants – TOM, funded by the European Commission
Componente estreno: PRIN 2008, Allocazione del credito compatibile con gliincentivi, liquidità e regolazione
Componente: The New IAB-SOEP Migration Sample
Componente esterno: PRIN 2010-2011, “Asymmetric information, adjustment costs and allocative efficiency: microeconomic foundation and macroeconomic implications”
Responsabile: IAB project, Pareto improvements in GEI economies
Responsabile: IAB project, Migration and Female Labour Market Supply

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Referee: Empirical Economics, Bulletin of Economic Policy, The B.E. Journal of Economic, Analysis & Policy, Journal of Public Economic Theory, International Journal of Economic Sciences, Journal for Labour Market Research.

Member: European Economic Association, European Association of Labour Economists, European Society for Population Economics, Association for Public Economic Theory, Association of Southern European Economic Theorists, Association of Mathematics Applied to Economics and Social Sciences, Italian Economic Association, Italian Association of Labour Economics, Italian Association for Public Economics.

Visiting Scholar : Columbia University, New York, USA (February 2010); Columbia University, New York, USA (April 2012); University of Bologna, Bologna, Italy (January 2012); University of Ca’ Foscari, Venice, Italy (January 2014); University of Ca’ Foscari, Venice, Italy (May 2016); University of Bologna, Bologna, Italy (September 2016).
Member of IAB WORKING GROUPS: Migration and Integration, Skilled Labour requirments (2010-2015), Gender Studies

(Coautore di) Policy brief reports: “Mit Reformen gegen die Jobmisere: Rückenwind für den italienischen Arbeitsmarkt?”, with R.Konle-Seidl, IAB-Forum, Nr. 2, 2015, pp 14-19 (ISSN:1861-7522); “Fachkräftebedarf in Deutschland, Zur kurz- und langfristigen Entwicklung von Fachkräfteangebot und -nachfrage, Arbeitslosigkeit und Zuwanderung.”, with H.Brücker, S.Brunow, J.Fuchs, A.Kubis, E.Weber, IAB-Stellungnahme 01/2013, pp 1-18 (ISSN: 2195-5980); “Ländervergleich in Westeuropa: Wo sich Bildung für Frauen mehr lohnt als für Männer”, with T.Rhein, IAB-Kurzbericht 05/2012 (ISSN: 0942-167X); “Ländervergleich in Westeuropa: Gute Bildung steht Frauen oft besser als Männern“, with T.Rhein, IAB-Forum, Nr. 1, 2012, pp 68-73 ISSN:1861-7522).
